citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
When the licensee was asked for the program of veterinary care (PVC), the licensee stated that he went to the Attending
Veterinarians (AV) office two times to pick up the PVC but it was unavailable. After inspection the AV was contacted by
the inspector concerning the PVC and per the AV the PVC was picked up by the licensee on the second visit to his office.
Not providing the PVC to the inspector at time of inspection hinders the inspector’s ability to determine appropriate
authority of the veterinarian over veterinary care of animals held at the facility. Without the PVC the inspector cannot
ensure all written aspects of the PVC are being followed to ensure the health of the animals and to maintain the animals
in good health.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall assure that the attending veterinarian has appropriate authority to ensure the provision of
adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of other aspects of animal care and use.
To be corrected from this day forward, December 19, 2023.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There is a small, young, red zebu with an ear tag in the right ear that has prominent hip bones and the ribs can be seen
through the hair of the zebu. The licensee is aware of the condition of this animal but has not contacted the attending
veterinarian concerning the condition of this animal for a diagnosis and treatment plan.
Lack of contact with the attending veterinarian concerning animal health and behavioral issues can lead to prolonged
disease processes and deterioration of the animals’ health and body condition.
Each dealer or exhibitor shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation
of all animals to assess their health and well-being; Provided, however, That daily observation of animals may be
accomplished by someone other than the attending veterinarian; and Provided, further, That a mechanism of direct and
frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and
well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian so that a diagnosis and treatment plan can be accomplished.
To be corrected by December 21, 2023

-The licensee does not have a record of animals on hand.
-The licensee has one male goat and one male sheep on loan for breeding and does not have record of where these
animals are located.
-The licensee has transferred ownership of a young female zebu twice and has no record of where the animal went or
when it came back to the facility.
All licensees must keep accurate records of all animals acquired and dispersed to trace and track animals in the case of
animal disease outbreak, and to ensure all parties that are required to be licensed have a current and active license with
the USDA, APHIS, Animal Care.
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following
information concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased, or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise
disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her
possession or under his or her control.
To be corrected from this day forward, December 19, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
